data.title: Remove custom terrain when clearing resources.
Improved automatic map selection.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: The existing behavior tends to default to a custom map, which messes with the map options and is generally not expected behavior.  This changes the behavior to pick a random conquest map that is 128x128 or smaller and allows bots.

data.title: mission-settings over conquest-default-settings ?
data.body:
when i  load a "mission" ... the settings will stay that way (aka. no crates , no buildradius) even when i switch to a conquest-map ... 

it happens to alot of "admins" .. that they dont check the settings and manually adjust it back ... so theres sometimes games with "crates off , build radius off" ... 

(btw. the first map that always pops up on a fresh new install , is "allies01" ... and thats a mission ... ) 

pretty annoying 

![openraannoy](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1997864/1704536/b149ba42-60cc-11e3-83db-1ce34a6fd15b.png)

data.title: D2K palette fixes

data.body: Fixes issues with palette remaps and cliffs.

data.title: playtest 20131209  long chat text does not  switch to a new line
Support using PCM WAV files for music
data.body:
Since OpenRA already supports WAV files, as far as I can tell from rummaging through the code there are only two issues to solve (which exceed my abilities right now, unfortunately) to support PCM .wav for music:

1) MusicInfo.cs is currently hardcoded to only look for files with .aud extension.

2) WavLoader does not yet have an equivalent to AudLoader's SoundLength function.

Changing this could serve as both a stop-gap solution for those that want stereo, high-quality in-game music support (I do, for instance), as well as a first step towards supporting more audio formats like OGG and/or IMA ADPCM (RA2) later on.

data.title: Fixed crash when disguising the spy as an infantry without stand2 animations

data.title: lst should use its loading/unloading frames
Packaging Script Corrections

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: Problems I found when going through our packaging scripts. Extracted from #4246 for the stable release.

data.title: Fix map format incompatibilities
data.body:
This will fixes issues introduced by the content site adding RequiresMod to all maps and changing their IDs.
The map format has been bumped to 6, which requires RequiresMod to be defined. Any locally installed maps will be upgraded, keeping them consistent with the content site.

@ihptru will need to run `OpenRA.Utility.exe --upgrade-map <path>` in order for this to work.

The map editor will need testing to ensure that the PickAny option still works.

data.title: Enforce Map.RequiresMod
data.body: Preparation complete: #4250, #4249 and http://content.open-ra.org has been updated. This fixes problems like #3033.

data.title: MapFormat increment checklist
data.body:
- [ ] Fix up the map smudge yaml layout. `cr1 60,79 0:` is inconsistent in that it doesn't follow the idiomatic yaml tree structure that we use for everything else.
- [ ] Let all files in map archives contribute to the map uid, instead of just map.yaml and map.bin. This lets maps with edited Lua code have different uids.
- [ ] Allow rules to be in their own files in addition to map.yaml.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1350490-mapformat-increment-checklist?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Update distributed maps with RequiresMod where it's missing
fix #4236; Editor has to add RequiresMod to map.yaml
Handle all Linux packaging downstream
data.body:
I can't waste whole weekends fiddling with these horrible packaging scripts anymore. They should be donated downstream and maintained there probably still partly in our control:
- [x] Fedora/openSUSE (RPM and others even DEB/PKG)  https://build.opensuse.org
- [ ] Debian/Ubuntu  https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+ppas 
- [x] Arch  https://aur.archlinux.org/
- [x] Gentoo  http://packages.gentoo.org/package/games-strategy/openra @cerebrum could upload playtests there

That gives us #3041 as it comes with proper repositories and #2635 as web interfaces like http://openbuildservice.org allow us to check if the build fails on various VMs without SSHing into just one instance (build.open-ra.org) which tries to hack together packages for systems it does not really understand. Might also advertise the project better.
